overview:
Thomas Kramer, who was recently named one of the top 10 CFOs in Washington, D.C. by SmartCEO magazine, has led Cvent’s Finance, Strategy and Administrative divisions since the company’s inception. Thomas is an industry expert and leading decision-maker in the eCommerce arena. His industry knowledge and experience span management strategy, corporate finance, internet marketing, online customer service, and site logistics.

While at the Boston Consulting Group, he created eCommerce strategy and management analyses for leading North American corporations and organizations, including a premier Wall Street investment bank, for whom he helped build a new online business unit. He managed Andersen Consulting’s (now Accenture’s) research efforts in eCommerce at their consumer products R&D facility, Smart Store Europe.

Thomas graduated with an MBA from Harvard Business School, where he studied Strategy and Finance. While at Harvard, Thomas co-wrote Amazon.com’s eCommerce strategy case study, which is currently a part of the core curricula at Harvard and other top-ranked MBA programs. In addition, he was Editor-in-Chief of the Business School’s newspaper, the Harbus. Thomas also graduated Cum Laude from the Norwegian School of Economics, with an MS in Economics. The Norwegian Trade Council awarded him a scholarship for his thesis in international strategic marketing. Thomas Kramer was recently named one of the top 10 CFOs in Washington DC by SmartCEO magazine.
